parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Patience, forbearance, longsuffering. From the same as makrothumos; longanimity, i.e. forbearance or fortitude.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence. From sophos; wisdom.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
